action.action-desc: Ms. Hageman (for herself and Mr. Pappas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To limit the closure or consolidation of any United States Postal Service processing and distribution center in States, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Postal Operations Stay Timely And Local Act or the POSTAL Act.

section.header: Limitation on closing or consolidating Postal Service processing and distribution centers in States

subsection.text: The United States Postal Service may not close, consolidate, downgrade, or take any other similar action with respect to any processing and distribution center in a State if such action would result in no such center being located in that State.

paragraph.text: the term processing and distribution center means a central mail facility that—

subparagraph.text: distributes and dispatches part or all of both incoming mail and outgoing mail for a designated service area;
provides instructions on the preparation of collection mail, dispatch schedules, and sorting plan requirements to mailers; and
is a sectional center facility, a general mail facility, or a dedicated mail processing facility without a station or branch; and

paragraph.text: the term State means the 50 States and the District of Columbia.
